intro: Trichostema micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Oregon. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Trichostema micranthum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in Mediterranean climates.
